Why do I not recommend this game? Cause victims are more powerful than killer.
Maybe first two weeks it'll be funny and precious interesting to play this game in processing asking me what I've found bad here. But it'll be a few weeks, after you want to play killer and understand everything. It's painful to be a rapist. 
You chase one guy all the game crushing f...ing pallets, maybe finally catch him and understand that the gates are opened and your last actions you can do- it's just try to kill this bastard you catched before which now is suspended on the crook (hook). And just try to keep him there, cause it's impossible if you're playing by Nurse or Wraith. Understand this and you'll get that this game is not about avoid the killer and escape the trial, it's about how to catch them all the victims. 
I still keep silent and don't talk about the optimization and community. So if you want to play- then play, but it's maximum for one-two month.

So right off the bat I just want to say that I love Dead by Daylight and everything that it has to offer! Right down to the gameplay, the perspectives of survivor and the killer and especially the thrill early on with playing the game that you get on both sides regardless of if you play killer or survivor. Despite the occasional bugs, exploits, balancing issues, toxicity and BM'ing that you might find in some parts of the DBD community, overall I love how this game is going and think it's truly got great potential and promise in store for it. 

From my point of view if I had to be critical of DBD I would only suggest that doing the same thing time and time again as a survivor and/or a killer tends to get a bit boring and I would suggest to have more variety in gameplay that players can choose with this game. I'm sure the devs are working on this even wayyyy before I'm writing this anyway.

Anyway keep up the overall good work devs! :)

I really like this game. I would like it even more if I could play it on Linux with "Linux + Steam OS".

Following in the footsteps of another game they ruined with microtransactions (Payday 2), Dead By Daylight is yet another Starbreeze game locking existing content behind a new microcurrency, which must be purchased with real money.  This microcurrency is in ADDITION to the two currencies you have to micromanage for progression, the inventory full of single-use items, and the costs of the DLC chapters themselves.

Aren't there consumer protection laws in the US that prohibit charging a second time for something someone's already purchased?

In the meantime - key features still don't work.  You will die from vaulting every time.  As soon as a chase starts, you begin rubberbanding, and the killer usually has you in seconds.  When you try to struggle, you can slam space ten times a second and it'll randomly tell you you failed to hit it and chomp you of - turning a component-ruining mechanic into a LUCK-BASED component-ruining mechanic.  AND THE GAME INTERCEPTS ALT-F4.  That's not how WIndows works, Starbreeze.

The game is very fun, but the buck is less I have a bug

Wednesday June 13th, 2018 about 2:40am, I laid my controller down for the last time to play Dead By Daylight.

While it had be fun, It just isn't anymore. At first it was a thrill renewed to hunt and be hunted. Due to exploits and poor response by the game developers, I no longer find "fun" in camping exploiters who abuse the pallets and window advantage excessively.

Is this the sole reason to move on? Partially, But I have more games which developers who are more deserving and responsive to their communities needs.There is an absolute uproar;War amongst hunters and survivors in many Forums lashing back and forth and yet this hasn't been handled.

Is this a bad game? By no means is it an outright bad game, But in hindsight what game can you no longer find matches because the majority of players are nearly the two lowest ranks? Game mechanics inwhich even the developer themselves were visibly,audibly and admittantly displeased with the match played live stream;With his hosts even laughing at him.

Did you really give it a chance? Yes! I was very excited and foregoing despite the disadvantages presented playing a Main killer character, Even played survivor a bit to Level 15. I even purchased a DLC to show my support!

Sadly I have to recommend only getting this game if you have atleast four friends who are willing to play this game as if it were a "gentleman's sport". However I hate to refer to this game as that due to the fact, This type of game shouldn't be played like a "gentleman's sport", and I believe that is actually discouraged by the developer's barring communication with the killers and survivors until the end of the match. Speaking of the end of match communication, It is the only game you have no means to please any player regardless of your playstyle or behavior, Whether you play a hardened killer;Who cares not to be declared a camper or noob by doing the first and preventing the opportunity for their allies to rescue their teammates. Or you allow them to do so the latter and not be called a degrogative term. I don't believe I could see this game improving as I can only assume the developers have no intention to remake the maps to allow space between the obstacles Survivors have an advantage.

No particular match caused this response, I just don't see how it is fun, Even after giving it 26+ hours to really get a firm grasp, Which I believe is more then most would had they not found fun. 

My personal experiences have really been subjective, As thousands of players are obviously happy enough to keep playing. But as a relatively new player;Entering the horror survival scenario, "I only saw the sparks, not the flame."-Myself

Until they start penalising leavers and preventing hook suicides, this game is a pretty big mess until you're rank 5 and above. Good luck getting there, every match someone either disconnects or suicides the moment they are hooked.

Edit: Suicides have been very slightly slowed down but are still an incredible problem. You can suicide within 10 seconds which leaves everyone else in the match at a massive disadvantage that pretty much guarantees a loss. 
Borrowed Time should be built into the game and not a perk. The amount of times a greedy survivor saves me and I got down literally instantly because the killer is right there. No one is punished but the person being saved. The savior gets points, the killer gets a down and a hook, the saved gets screwed and doesn't even get to try to get away.
I still play this game because it's fun when you get a non-jerk killer, but with crossplay, most killers these days play very meanly.
It was hard not to cuss in this review.

Portrait of a Murder update: The new killer is insanely overpowered. She can shoot through walls, block loops, snipe gens from across the map, and she moves at full speed. Devs just don't care about survivors anymore. Game isn't worth playing until she's deleted. Just to be clear, I understand survivors are OP. I can loop and survive most killers for several minutes, but The Artist is about 20-30 seconds tops if the player knows what they are doing. That's an insane difference. She needs to run at 4.4m/s or only be able to injure if you have crows on you. Not a free injure if they are close or full movement speed; you can't have both on the same killer.

The Essay:

   I've sunk a lot of time into this game, 400+ hours atm. I started as a survivor, up against the Doctor for my very first match. Let me tell you, he terrifed the ever living sh*t outa me. I had the friend who introduced me to the game talking me through it though, which is both a pro and con.

   Recently a basic tutorial was added, but there wasn't anything before that. New players were clueless. Having a friend feed me info meant I got the basics down faster... but I wasn't as scared as I could've been. That may sound wierd, but the beginning terror of seeing a red outline in the distance accompanied with a blood-curdling scream... it was superb.

   Of course, I know what that that means now, so it's just a big indicator for me - but the point is that it was gloriously scary - except for that friend whispering sweet nothings into my ear.

   For me, that is the start to the beauty of this game. As a cowering survivor, not knowing who's out there. As the smug killer, already licking my lips in anticipation of the hunt. I've had my heart beating over time, with pure adrenaline pumping through me. Fully tilting my body left - the killer swung but barely missed me! Leaning foward with an intense stare - that survivor will fall before me! Burying my face in my hands in despair - the Entity now has me.

   Then there's the more subtle things. Working on a generator, it's noise slowly but surely encompassing everything around me, to the point that I compulsively swivel my camera back and forth to make sure I'm not being snuck up on by the killer. Playing mind games with a frantic survivor - oh you thought I was going right? Thanks for running straight into my weapon XOXO.

   So, from an emotional standpoint I very much love Dead by Daylight. Logically, it has it's faults. The inevitable bugs, balance issues, one side feeling overlooked, so on and so on. That's just the usual for any mmo, far as I'm concerned.

   I'm more interested by the fact that they show obvious care for their community (weekly streams/youtube vids). That they show passion towards what they've created. That they try. That's all I ask for.

   Don't get me wrong, I've cursed up a storm because of this game. I've raged and thrown temper tantrums even a 4 year old would marvel at. At the same time, there's been so many instances of pure awesomness. Let me paint a picture of such one time:

   There's a chainwielding cannibal prowling on the grounds. I've heard the purr of their weapon as it ruthlessely cuts down all before it. My fellow sufferers - they scream in intense pain, wordlessly begging for mercy. But none does it have. I frantically work on the generator in front of me, swallowing down the delirious burbles of dread that want to escape. Already one has been gathered by the Entity, lifted almost lovingly, it's spindly arms cruelly thrust through their body.

   Finally, finally the contraption I've been on was completed! But then I hear a wail vibrate through the air. Swiveling around, I helplessly watch as the current victim lies cut in half on the ground, while that monster lifts it's weapon in the air and cheers. I'm almost numb at this point. Only two are still alive, with 3 of those infernal machines left to go. And as it turns and meets my eyes, I'm sure that there's no hope left.

   Yet! I wasn't going to make it easy. So off I ran, dodging around a corner, throwing wooden pallets to slow it down. Leaping through windows, back-tracking in the hopes of shaking it off. Around and around, I took it's attention. My only thought being to buy time for my last companion to do... something. Anything really. I just wanted to give them that time.

   In the end, it catches up. And I fall, withering onto the ground. Then lifted upon an uncaring shoulder and unceremoniously shoved on a hook. I hang limply, imploring the last one to make it out alive. But fate was nefarious, as the monster was granted momentary knowledge of their location... and went straight for them.

   I was in true despair. Did everything I'd work for mean absolutely nothing? Was this to mean that no matter what I would always fail? No. NO. NO! And with a strength I thought gone from me I reach up to struggle off that blasted hook - and succeed. That moment left me momentarily speechless, immediately followed with almost uncontrollable giddiness.

   The same could not be the same for my last ally, as their howl indicated that they had been caught and placed as an offering. Now with that momentary knowledge granted to the lunatic and the beat of a heart overwhelming the senses, I knew it was now or nothing. Every scrap of knowledge and dirty trick was employed, looking for that escape the Entity in its sadistic nature left for the last left alive.

   When I dodged around a rock, then double backed, causing the creature to lose me for a few precious seconds, I heard it. That dark, almost chorus like noise. With explosive glee I dived straight into the hatch, the monster too far to do more than sneer at me as it closed above my head.

   Then in the end chat, I wrote "OMG that was too close, gg!" Then the killer dude was like, "Trash" and left. Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯ 

   10/10 I adore this game. And if you read this far... thanks?

Here's a breakdown of how this game will go for you:

Stage 1: Get killed a lot, figure out how the game works, be frustrated (~2 Hrs)
Stage 2: Getting the hang of it, getting perks, starting to have fun (~2 Hrs)
Stage 3: The game is fun. You're good at generators, you know how to run/hide/save teammates and are confident. (~20 hours)
Stage 4: The game starts to feel stale. The DLC killers seems really unfair (Freddy). Start to get frustrated again, but also your not as into it anymore. (~4 hrs)
Stage 5: Maybe you and your friends try it out for a few games when there's nothing else to play. It's not a bad game, but it's repetitive and not much to keep you interested.

Or play the killer, which is the same, except where you chase instead of being chased. I guess that adds some playtime.

They just keep adding killers, but that's not what's needed to keep the game fresh, so once you're bored, new killers don't really matter.

My friend suggested adding more objectives than just the generators for the survivors to do, which would be great. Right now, just focusing on generators is kind of boring. Hopefully they rework the gameplay to add some fresh elements to it.

As it is, you'll get $20 worth of value out of the game, but it doesn't have lasting replayability.

I love this game, I truly do. However I have to leave a negative rating just simply because of how horrible the matchmaking can be and how it mostly is. If you play survivor you will probably get matched up against a killer who is incredibly amazing and kills everyone without breaking a sweat. On the other hand when you play as a killer you will have to deal with survivors who pallet loop, use flashlights, 360 you, and teabag every time you have to break a pallet or when they're at the exit and they just stand there taunting you because they know you can't do anything and they want to make your experience as horrible as possible. That's the issue with this game is the terribly toxic people who play it. Whether it is a killer who is face camping you, or a survivor who is pallet looping, using a flashlight, or 360ing you, you can't win. This will be the downfall of this game if Behaviour doesn't do something to fix this. As I previously stated, I love this game, but God, most of the people who play it, completely ruin it.
